metadata.name: Tale of Greed - Deforestation
metadata.description:
Hark! The capitalist man, with axe in hand,
Doth seeketh profit from the fertile land.
He chops the trees without a thought or care,
For in pursuit of gain, he is ensnared.

Yet in his greed, he fails to see the cost,
The consequences of his actions lost,
For with each tree he does so cruelly fell,
He doth metaphorically cut his leg as well.

The forests once did bloom, so lush and grand,
But now they wither, barren, dry, and bland,
A sacrifice to money's endless supply,
And in the end, the man will learn to cry.

For in his quest for wealth and fame,
He brought about destruction and shame,
Oh, how the heart aches to see,
The loss of nature's true beauty.

But alas, the man's eyes are blind,
To the destruction he leaves behind,
For profits and wealth he will always seek,
Even as he cuts down his own feet.
